intro: Acisanthera uniflora, commonly known as the single-flower acisanthera, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Its unique floral structure consists of a single flower per inflorescence, making it distinctive among its relatives. Acisanthera uniflora is of interest to botanists due to its ecological role and potential for medicinal use.
